gw.workqueue

Class PerfWorkQueueTestUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.workqueue.PerfWorkQueueTestUtil

  • public class PerfWorkQueueTestUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for running work queues in performance tests. Used from Gosu

      static void runForPerfTest(BatchProcessType queueType, long pollIntervalInMillis)
      Runs the given work queue for a performance test.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PerfWorkQueueTestUtil

    • Method Detail

      • runForPerfTest

        public static void runForPerfTest(BatchProcessType queueType,
                                  long pollIntervalInMillis)
                           throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.AlreadyRunningException,
                                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        Runs the given work queue for a performance test. First ensures there are no existing work items for the work queue as these could confuse the timing information. Then runs the writer and waits for it to finish (the workers are running while the writer is running, as would happen at a customer site). Then waits until all the work items are consumed. It polls the database to check for unprocessed work item (safer than trying to ask all the threads across the cluster whether they have "finished"), using the given poll interval
        Parameters:
        queueType - the work queue to be run
        pollIntervalInMillis - how often to check the database to see if all the work items are processed
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.AlreadyRunningException - if the writer process is already running
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for the writer or the worker threads to finish
